intro: Linnaea borealis f. retinervis, commonly known as the white twinflower, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its small, white, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are typically oval and have a smooth, waxy texture. This variant is distinguished by its reticulate venation pattern, which gives it its specific epithet. It is native to northern regions of North America and is often found in moist, acidic soils in forest understories.
